name: Coaching Baseball/Softball
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching baseball/softball.

name: Coaching Basketball
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching basketball.

name: Coaching Football
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching football.

name: Coaching Golf
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching golf.

name: Coaching Soccer
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching soccer.

name: Coaching Swimming and Diving
descripton: Theories, techniques and strategies of coaching swimming and diving.

name: Coaching Tennis
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching tennis.

name: Field/Cross-Country
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching track and field and cross-country.

name: Coaching Volleyball
descripton: Theories, techniques, and strategies of coaching volleyball.

name: Strength Training and Conditioning
descripton: Knowledge and skills necessary for designing and implementing strength and conditioning programs. This course does not constitute credit toward meeting the minimum university Physical Education requirements

name: Coaching Practicum
prerequisites: Prerequisite: Requires departmental consent, First Aid, and CPR Certification or Equivalent
descripton: Risk Management for details on acquiring the insurance and the current charge.

name: Athletic Training
prerequisites: Prerequisite: PEH 280 or PEH 281 or CPR/First aid Certification
descripton: Incidence, causes, prevention and treatment of sports-related injuries.  Conditioning for sports, injury recognition and evaluation, taping techniques, first aid care, treatment and reconditioning.

name: Coaching Concepts
descripton: Practical and theoretical concepts essential to the preparation of coaches. This course does not constitute credit toward meeting Physical Education requirements

name: Exercise Physiology and Sports Science
descripton: Basic principles of human anatomy, physiology, and biomechanics and their relationship to athletic coaching.

name: Sport Management
descripton: Planning, organizing, leading, and evaluating within a sport context; fundamentals of accounting, budgeting, economics, marketing, strategic planning, ethics, and their use in sport settings; techniques of personnel, facility, and sporting event management.
